attributes.additional_details:
British Government should ensure that paid up holders of British TV licenses should be able to use their license numbers/details to log in when they are abroad and have access to online television and other media services, which they as license holders have partially funded.

The are currently denied access (according to the BBC website) due to 'rights issues', which means that the companies and organisations involved prefer to make extra money by selling distribution rights abroad and thus deny those who have assisted with the funding of such media content in the first place access to it, which is grossly unfair.
